# pixelFormat

**Instance Property**

The pixel format of the layer’s textures.

## Declaration

```swift
var pixelFormat: MTLPixelFormat { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLPixelFormat/bgra8Unorm].

You must use one of the following formats:

- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLPixelFormat/bgra8Unorm]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLPixelFormat/bgra8Unorm_srgb]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLPixelFormat/rgba16Float]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLPixelFormat/rgb10a2Unorm]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLPixelFormat/bgr10a2Unorm]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLPixelFormat/bgra10_xr]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLPixelFormat/bgra10_xr_srgb]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLPixelFormat/bgr10_xr]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLPixelFormat/bgr10_xr_srgb]

## Configuring the Layer’s Drawable Objects

- **colorspace**: The color space of the rendered content.
- **framebufferOnly**: A Boolean value that determines whether the layer’s textures are used only for rendering.
- **drawableSize**: The size, in pixels, of textures for rendering layer content.
